description: French fries, also known as chips, fries, finger chips, or French-fried potatoes, are batonnet or allumette-cut deep-fried potatoes.
steps: Peel the potatoes and cut them into batonnet or allumette shapes, approximately 1/4 inch thick.
Rinse the potato sticks in cold water to remove excess starch. Then, pat them dry with paper towels or a clean kitchen towel.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 325째F (163째C).
Carefully add the potato sticks to the hot oil in batches, ensuring not to overcrowd the fryer. Fry for about 5-7 minutes, or until they are pale and slightly cooked but not browned.
Remove the partially cooked fries from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil. Let them cool for a few minutes.
Once the oil is hot, return the partially cooked fries to the oil in batches and fry for an additional 2-4 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove the fries from the oil and place them on a clean paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil. Season with salt to taste.
Serve the French fries hot with ketchup or your favorite dipping sauce. Enjoy!
